faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about Base64 PDF conversion

whatIsBase64.question: What is Base64 encoding?
whatIsBase64.answer: Base64 is an encoding method that uses 64 printable characters to represent binary data. It's commonly used to transmit binary data like PDFs in text protocols.

whyUseBase64.question: Why convert PDF to Base64?
whyUseBase64.answer: Converting pdf to base64 encoding allows direct embedding in HTML, JSON and other text formats, convenient for web applications while avoiding compatibility issues with binary data transmission.

fileSizeLimit.question: Is there a file size limit?
fileSizeLimit.answer: Currently supports PDF files up to 100MB. For larger files, we recommend compressing PDFs first or splitting into multiple smaller files.

securityConcerns.question: Is the conversion process secure?
securityConcerns.answer: Yes, all conversion operations are completed in your browser, files are not uploaded to servers, ensuring your documents are completely private and secure.

browserCompatibility.question: Which browsers are supported?
browserCompatibility.answer: Supports all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, etc. We recommend using the latest browser versions for the best experience.

base64Size.question: Does Base64 encoding increase file size?
base64Size.answer: Yes, Base64 encoding typically increases file size by about 33%. This is normal for the encoding process, and the original size is restored after decoding.

qualityLoss.question: Is there quality loss during conversion?
qualityLoss.answer: No. Base64 is lossless encoding, the conversion process doesn't change document content or quality, decoded files are identical to originals.

batchProcessing.question: Does it support batch processing?
batchProcessing.answer: Currently supports single file processing. For batch needs, you can use this tool multiple times or consider using our API service.

supportedFormats.question: Which PDF versions are supported?
supportedFormats.answer: Supports all standard PDF versions and formats, ensuring compatibility with documents created by different applications.

howToUse.question: How to use the converted Base64 encoding?
howToUse.answer: You can directly embed Base64 encoding in HTML, transmit through APIs, or store in databases for base64 to pdf conversion when needed.
